subject: RE: [junit] Definitions question
msgSnippet: ... Thanks. I ll follow up on that one. This is the kind of book recommendation that I was hoping for. ... Simon
messageBody:
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Harald Mueller [mailto:harald.m.mueller@...]
>Sent: Wednesday, October 13, 2004 6:58 AM
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [junit] Definitions question
>
>
>
>> Message: 3
>> Date: Tue, 12 Oct 2004 14:47:05 -0500
>> From: "Chappell, Simon P" <simon.chappell@...>
>> Subject: Definitions question
>>
>> We're having some "robust" discussions about testing here
>and one of the
>> big issues concerns correct nomenclature for testing types
>and levels and
>> scopes. Does anyone have any book recommendations to help
>with industry
>> accepted terms and definitions?
>
>Get Boris Beizer's "Black Box Testing" (Myers is too old). "Black Box
>Testing" has lots of pages with nomenclature, and B.Beizer
>counts as one of
>the (or maybe even the) guru in the area of testing (overall),
>so what he
>says is definitely "industry standard". Whether you then (as a
>group or as
>individuals) decide to follow his definitions, is of course your
>(meta-)decision ...

Thanks. I'll follow up on that one. This is the kind of book recommendation that I was hoping for.

>Regards
>Harald M. Mueller

Simon
